From:	Heidi L. Dempsey [hdempsey@jsu.edu]
Sent:	Thursday, March 26, 2009 11:57 AM
To:	evilsax@gmail.com
Cc:	jsu1535n@jsu.edu; jejaggedge@gmail.com; David Dempsey; hdempsey@jsu.edu; agarrett@jsu.edu; David Thornton
Subject:	DiSH program

Hi Tony (and Jaleesa),

I just realized we are missing two demographic variables in the program 
you showed me.  These were ones that we provided in the our feedback on 
the DiSH analysis document.  First, we need to know their year in 
school.  It needs to be required that they answer this question.  Also, 
can you make it like you did with age so the default start of the list 
is 1st semester freshman in college?  Here's the question and menu choices:

What is your school classification?
4th grader
5th grader
6th grader
7th grader
8th grader
9th grader
10th grader
11th grader
12th grader
1st semester freshman in college
2nd semester freshman in college
3rd or 4th semester freshman in college
sophomore in college
junior in college
senior in college
5th-year senior or beyond in college
masters-level graduate student
doctoral-level graduate student
not currently enrolled in school

Also, there should be a textbox (around 20 characters wide) that is 
labeled "Participating Course" where they can enter information about 
the course they are receiving credit for.  This should NOT be a required 
field.

Best,
Dr. Dempsey

-- 
----------------------------------
Heidi L. Dempsey, Ph.D.
Assistant Professor of Psychology
Jacksonville State University
700 Pelham Road North
Jacksonville, AL 36265
(256) 782-5895
hdempsey@jsu.edu

> Administrator B, login and create some queries. Ok so now we have to admins

From:	Logan Moore [loganjmoore@gmail.com]
Sent:	Sunday, March 29, 2009 8:49 PM
To:	Tony Teem
Subject:	Re: Hey!

Tony,
It's going pretty good, a couple of questions.

1.) If administrator A, is logged in and saves some queries, then you have
Administrator B, login and create some queries. Ok so now we have to admins
that have access to the admin panel and can view the queries created. Can
they view each other's created queries? If not and they are only able to
view their own, I need a way to get their username so I know who the user
is. This may be something we don't want to worry about this late in the
game, and just let all Administrators view all of the queries created. I am
going to program it like that for now. If you have any questions or comments
let me know, we can discuss it tomorrow if need be.

2.) I sent Dr. Garrett an email about this but I haven't heard back from him
yet. I probably will hear back from him later, but maybe you have ran across
this before. If I need to programmatically  create many instances of a
JComboBox, or a text field or any other form component. How would you do it,
I'm trying to figure it out for the query builder form, when the user hits
the checkbox it should continue to add Combo Boxes, I will figure something
out but thought maybe you could give me some direction.

Thanks,
Logan

Subject:	Re: DiSH

This will fix it... in bold

scrollPanePanel = new JPanel(new MigLayout("fill"));
scrollPanePanel.setLayout(new BorderLayout());
scrollPanePanel.add(loadPanel);
scrollPane = new JScrollPane(scrollPanePanel);
//scrollPane.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(1000,685));
add(scrollPane, "center");

From: Heidi L. Dempsey <hdempsey@jsu.edu>
Date: Thu, Mar 26, 2009 at 11:57 AM
Subject: DiSH program
To: evilsax@gmail.com
Cc: jsu1535n@jsu.edu, jejaggedge@gmail.com, David Dempsey <ddempsey@jsu.edu>,
hdempsey@jsu.edu, agarrett@jsu.edu, David Thornton <dthornton@jsu.edu>


Hi Tony (and Jaleesa),

I just realized we are missing two demographic variables in the program you
showed me.  These were ones that we provided in the our feedback on the DiSH
analysis document.  First, we need to know their year in school.  It needs
to be required that they answer this question.  Also, can you make it like
you did with age so the default start of the list is 1st semester freshman
in college?  Here's the question and menu choices:

What is your school classification?
4th grader
5th grader
6th grader
7th grader
8th grader
9th grader
10th grader
11th grader
12th grader
1st semester freshman in college
2nd semester freshman in college
3rd or 4th semester freshman in college
sophomore in college
junior in college
senior in college
5th-year senior or beyond in college
masters-level graduate student
doctoral-level graduate student
not currently enrolled in school

Also, there should be a textbox (around 20 characters wide) that is labeled
"Participating Course" where they can enter information about the course
they are receiving credit for.  This should NOT be a required field.

Best,
Dr. Dempsey

-- 
----------------------------------
Heidi L. Dempsey, Ph.D.
Assistant Professor of Psychology
Jacksonville State University
700 Pelham Road North
Jacksonville, AL 36265
(256) 782-5895
hdempsey@jsu.edu

API but is created by the user and extends java.lang.exception.. Anyone know
anything about this?

Subject:	Re: hey

I think I have a solution...
try{ Thread.sleep(2000); }
catch(InterruptedException e){ System.out.println("sleep didn't work"); }

this code will freeze a program for x number of milliseconds, might help
with your blank panel problem.

From:	Tony Teem [evilsax@gmail.com]
Sent:	Wednesday, April 01, 2009 9:28 PM
To:	Jaleesa Elston
Subject:	Re: next

if you are going to compile using ant, all you have to do is type "ant" into
the command line in the root directory of the project.then you type "cd
dist"
then "java -jar dish.jar"

if that is your question, hope I understood it correctly.

>From:	Tony Teem [evilsax@gmail.com]
Sent:	Wednesday, April 01, 2009 9:18 PM
To:	Jaleesa Elston
Subject:	Re: next

oh wow, you are using netbeans? I haven't the slightest clue where MigLayout
needs to be... We've just been using notepad++ to edit all our code and
using a command line compiler.. I really havent' the slightest clue where
add-in jar files need to be placed for a good compile.
Btw, using ant will compile the code and place all the files you need to run
the code in the dist directory. You might want to try adding the miglayout
file to your PATH, and it doesn't matter what it is named, so if you wanna
rename it to MigLayout and place it in a temp directory that would be fine.

To:	Logan Moore
Subject:	bug!

One bug i've noticed so far with your DBUI. When you click edit user it
doesn't set the privilege drop down box to the privilege the person actually
has. You know the code better than I, can you fix this easily?
Thanks,
Tony

btw, i did edit a bit of your code, trying to remove the border, but
removing a border from a tabbed pane is a huge hassle. but I also made some
changes I left, can't remember what so make sure you update your code before
you edit it.
From:	Lori Liles [lileslori@gmail.com]
Sent:	Wednesday, April 01, 2009 7:54 PM
To:	Tony Teem
Subject:	Re: Meeting

Ok, so I got it fixed, which by the looks of what time it is now I'm going
to fail my test tomorrow since I haven't even started studying.  There are 3
usernames: loganmoore(pw: bob), bobbyj(pw: jones), and dish(pw: dish).  You
can test them all now.  I had to change some of his code.  He only had it
checking the username, so I had to add the password in there.  Also, if the
username has stuff in it, but not the password it will pop up an error
message for the password, and vice versa.  If both are empty it pops up an
error message saying both are invalid.  Test it every which way you can.  I
think I have that part bug proof now.  I hope so at least.  I tested it
every which way.  The only thing is I edited the bobbyj username and when I
ran it again it passed the wrong privilege number back, so that would be the
only thing that would go wrong.  I have no idea why it did that, I went and
edited it again and it fixed it.  Go figure!

>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>> just put it in some directory, then name the package that
>>>>>>>>>>>> directory.
>>>>>>>>>>>> compile everything in that directory
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>> Make a MainClass.txt document. In it put Main-Class: [directory
>>>>>>>>>>>> name].[main class name] (note:  no .java and make sure the file has 2 lines,
>>>>>>>>>>>> the 2nd one should be blank)
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>> then:  jar cmfv MainClass.txt YOURJARNAME.jar "the name of the
>>>>>>>>>>>> directory you just made"
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>> and to execute:  java -jar YOURJARNAME.jar
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>> call me if you have questions, i'm about to head out for some
>>>>>>>>>>>> grub.

>>>>>>>>> just put it in some directory, then name the package that
>>>>>>>>> directory.
>>>>>>>>> compile everything in that directory
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Make a MainClass.txt document. In it put Main-Class: [directory
>>>>>>>>> name].[main class name] (note:  no .java and make sure the file has 2 lines,
>>>>>>>>> the 2nd one should be blank)
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> then:  jar cmfv MainClass.txt YOURJARNAME.jar "the name of the
>>>>>>>>> directory you just made"
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> and to execute:  java -jar YOURJARNAME.jar
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> call me if you have questions, i'm about to head out for some grub.

From:	Lori Liles [lileslori@gmail.com]
Sent:	Wednesday, April 01, 2009 3:18 PM
To:	Tony Teem
Subject:	Re: Meeting

It's fixed now....try it!  The login panel looks good!  Usernames are first
names all lowercased...Passwords are last names all lowercased.  Unless
someone changes them.  I couldn't add Andrew.  I figured it wouldn't matter,
b/c he probably won't look at it.  Anywho, there's a bogus one in there with
username: bobbyj password: jones  That one is an experimenter.  All of us
are admin.  Try them both and check out the menuBar.

From:	Tony Teem [evilsax@gmail.com]
Sent:	Wednesday, April 01, 2009 12:25 PM
To:	Lori Liles
Subject:	Re: Meeting

just put it in some directory, then name the package that directory.
compile everything in that directory

Make a MainClass.txt document. In it put Main-Class: [directory name].[main
class name] (note:  no .java and make sure the file has 2 lines, the 2nd one
should be blank)

then:  jar cmfv MainClass.txt YOURJARNAME.jar "the name of the directory you
just made"

and to execute:  java -jar YOURJARNAME.jar

call me if you have questions, i'm about to head out for some grub.

From:	Aaron Garrett [aaron.lee.garrett@gmail.com]
Sent:	Wednesday, April 01, 2009 10:23 AM
To:	Tony Teem; Jaleesa
Subject:	Re: help?

The problem is that you're using my SaxExperimentHandler instead of the (I
assume) ExperimentLoader. My class isn't equipped to handle your XML file
components, and it gets confused and tries to read a string as an integer.

Jaleesa's class doesn't yet do what it needs to do, because I tried using it
instead but it has problems that need to be fixed very soon. If you're going
to use my class, you need to use it to open the old XML file (before all of
the changes/additions were made).


Aaron Garrett, Ph.D.
Assistant Professor
Computer Science
Jacksonville State University
Jacksonville, AL  36265
agarrett@jsu.edu

http://mcis.jsu.edu/faculty/agarrett

--
-- Table structure for table `experiment-method`
--

CREATE TABLE `experiment-method` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
  `mid` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `eid` int(11) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY  (`id`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 COLLATE=latin1_general_ci AUTO_INCREMENT=1 ;

--
-- Dumping data for table `experiment-method`
--


-- --------------------------------------------------------

--
-- Table structure for table `experiment`
--

CREATE TABLE `experiment` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
  `title` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `date_time_start` timestamp NOT NULL default CURRENT_TIMESTAMP on update CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
  `date_time_end` timestamp NOT NULL default '0000-00-00 00:00:00',
  `exp_num` int(11) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY  (`id`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 COLLATE=latin1_general_ci AUTO_INCREMENT=2 ;

--
-- Dumping data for table `experiment`
--

INSERT INTO `experiment` VALUES (1, 'red haired lady', '2009-03-08 23:23:00', '2009-03-24 23:04:05', 1);

-- --------------------------------------------------------

--
-- Table structure for table `investigator-experiment`
--

CREATE TABLE `investigator-experiment` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
  `iid` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `eid` int(11) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY  (`id`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 COLLATE=latin1_general_ci AUTO_INCREMENT=1 ;

--
-- Dumping data for table `investigator-experiment`
--


-- --------------------------------------------------------

--
-- Table structure for table `investigator`
--

CREATE TABLE `investigator` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
  `username` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `password` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `first_name` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `last_name` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `department` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `privilege` int(11) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY  (`id`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 COLLATE=latin1_general_ci AUTO_INCREMENT=7 ;

-- Dumping data for table `investigator`
--

-- --------------------------------------------------------

--
-- Table structure for table `method-scenario`
--

CREATE TABLE `method-scenario` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
  `mid` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `sid` int(11) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY  (`id`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 COLLATE=latin1_general_ci AUTO_INCREMENT=1 ;

--
-- Dumping data for table `method-scenario`
--


-- --------------------------------------------------------

--
-- Table structure for table `method`
--

CREATE TABLE `method` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
  `type` char(2) collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `max_time` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `resp_delay` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `min_reward` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `max_reward` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY  (`id`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 COLLATE=latin1_general_ci AUTO_INCREMENT=1 ;

--
-- Dumping data for table `method`
--


-- --------------------------------------------------------

--
-- Table structure for table `participant-experiment`
--

CREATE TABLE `participant-experiment` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
  `eid` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `pid` int(11) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY  (`id`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 COLLATE=latin1_general_ci AUTO_INCREMENT=1 ;

--
-- Dumping data for table `participant-experiment`
--


-- --------------------------------------------------------

--
-- Table structure for table `participant`
--

CREATE TABLE `participant` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
  `first_name` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `last_name` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `age` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `gender` char(1) collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `race` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY  (`id`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 COLLATE=latin1_general_ci AUTO_INCREMENT=2 ;

--
-- Dumping data for table `participant`
--

INSERT INTO `participant` VALUES (1, 'Logan', 'Moore', 23, 'm', 'Black or African American');

-- --------------------------------------------------------

--
-- Table structure for table `querylibrary`
--

CREATE TABLE `querylibrary` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
  `queryname` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `querycode` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY  (`id`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 COLLATE=latin1_general_ci AUTO_INCREMENT=5 ;

--
-- Dumping data for table `querylibrary`
--

INSERT INTO `querylibrary` VALUES (1, 'blah', 'SELECT Age,Race,Gender,FROM participant WHERE Race = @Black or African American@');
INSERT INTO `querylibrary` VALUES (2, 'mary', 'SELECT Age,Gender,Race,FROM participant WHERE Race = `Black or African American`');
INSERT INTO `querylibrary` VALUES (3, 'ssssssssss', 'SELECT Age,Gender,Race,FROM participant WHERE Race = @Asian or Pacific Islander@');
INSERT INTO `querylibrary` VALUES (4, 'Participant', 'SELECT * FROM participant');

-- --------------------------------------------------------

--
-- Table structure for table `scenario-option`
--

CREATE TABLE `scenario-option` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
  `reward_value` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `reward_units` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `time_value` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  `time_units` text collate latin1_general_ci NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY  (`id`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 COLLATE=latin1_general_ci AUTO_INCREMENT=1 ;

--
-- Dumping data for table `scenario-option`
--


-- --------------------------------------------------------

--
-- Table structure for table `scenario`
--

CREATE TABLE `scenario` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
  `choice` int(11) default NULL,
  `tsps` int(11) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY  (`id`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 COLLATE=latin1_general_ci AUTO_INCREMENT=1 ;

--
-- Dumping data for table `scenario`
--

From:	Jaleesa Elston [jejaggedge@gmail.com]
Sent:	Friday, April 03, 2009 1:01 PM
To:	Aaron Garrett
Cc:	computerdude7@gmail.com; evilsax@gmail.com
Subject:	help

Dr. Garrett,

I'm writing this email regarding Andrew.  As I'm sure that you are aware of,
he has contributed very little so far, and I was hoping that perhaps you
could talk to him and try to "light a fire" underneath him.  I know that if
we really haven't needed him this far, we probably won't need him now,
however *I want to give a final chance to really contribute*.  I have told
him before that the team needs him to contribute more to this project, but
alas, nothing much has changed.

Logan continually tells me that he contributes very little, and Logan is
feeling pretty overwhelmed so far.  Logan has also informed me that
communication with Andrew is slow; it's hard to come into contact with him.
Since my part is mostly done, I will begin to help Logan with the database,
doing what I can.

If you don't think it will help talking at this point, that's fine.  I'm
just at the end of my rope, and just about wish I could take his name off
the whole project.

Thanks,

Jaleesa

DISH WORKS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! IT LOADS EXPERIMENTS
NOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Why it didn't work before:

In order to use a JPanel you have to instantiate it... we never instantiated
the mainContentPanel so it couldn't add it to the frame!

also, about your strange button issue, what if you did
getTopLevelAncestor().validate()

that should validate the entire frame.

YAY!

Tony

option".  That's not instructions...I don't understand why she wrote it that
way.  Maybe I'm wrong, I don't know.  Anyways, take a look at it if you
wanna.  Ignore the instruction panels when you get to the multiple choice
and all, for some reason it's not pulling the right card or something.  I'll
have to work on it some more.  But, i've got to take a break right now.  I'm
tired of looking at all of this.

Hope you had fun at your competition!

That's what he wantswhy I spent so much time on it.
We also have to add a counter to give him a total for "wasted space", ie,
everytime a job is added to a memory segment, we have to subtract the size
of the segment from the size of the job and add that to a running total.

We don't want instructions before each and every method, we only want an
instruction before the first method of that type is displayed... so we see
instructions on the first MC but not on an MC after that.

From:	David Thornton [david.c.thornton@gmail.com]
Sent:	Monday, April 06, 2009 8:07 AM
To:	Tony Teem
Subject:	Re: Your code

Tony,

i think those two class files are not packaged (ie, i always did a:
javac -cp .;cgjsapi.jar Blah.java

the "classpath" with the "." was what included those files.  i took
them from cloudgarden, but i would be content to recompile them with
your package structure, if you'll tell me how it goes.


On Sun, Apr 5, 2009 at 12:47 PM, Tony Teem <evilsax@gmail.com> wrote:
> Always figure it out after I send the email. I got most of the errors fixed
> by adding the cgjsapi.jar and the .dll to the lib and adding all of that to
> the build.xml, but I am still getting 2 errors saying that it cannot find
> TestAudioListener and TestEngineListener. They are both in the src code
> repository, so now i'm stumped on that.
>
> On Sun, Apr 5, 2009 at 12:39 PM, Tony Teem <evilsax@gmail.com> wrote:
>>
>> Ok, so we are using Apache Ant to handle our compiles and all of that
>> stuff. Where are we supposed to put the .class files from your code? I tried
>> putting it in our src/edu/jsu/dish folder but I'm getting a ton of errors.
>> I'm kinda weak with Ant so i'm not sure what I need to do to get all this
>> put in. The errors we are getting are all "cannot find symbol" errors. Do we
>> need to put it somewhere else, or does the code need to have package data
>> added to each one?
>> Hope this makes sense...
>> Tony
>

From:	Tony Teem [evilsax@gmail.com]
Sent:	Monday, April 13, 2009 6:21 PM
To:	Jaleesa Elston
Subject:	Re: xml

No, as far as I know it is not right. The objective for the "tick marks" is
so they can set them themselves. so you need a function to set each
individual tick mark to an int. for example.
Tick1 = 1
Tick2 = 8
etc

whatever they want to show on the slide ruler is what they need to specify
for each tick.
so what I suggest is you read them all in, convert them to integers, then
push each integer into an array of size 10. then pass that 10 piece array
into the realtime.java file.

On Mon, Apr 13, 2009 at 4:31 PM, Jaleesa Elston <jejaggedge@gmail.com>wrote:

> to load an experiment.

> Jaleesa

>> is so they can set them themselves. so you need a function to set each
>> individual tick mark to an int. for example.
>> Tick1 = 1
>> Tick2 = 8
>> etc
>>
>> whatever they want to show on the slide ruler is what they need to specify
>> for each tick.

From:	Aaron Garrett [aaron.lee.garrett@gmail.com]
Sent:	Wednesday, April 15, 2009 5:25 PM
To:	Tony Teem
Subject:	Re: Hash Table... not as exciting as it sounds?

Man. Ask me about hash tables in person and I'll explain it. It would take
too long to type it out. As for "is it right?", if the slider says it will
take a Hashtable for the labels, then what you're doing with the table is
reasonable.


Aaron Garrett, Ph.D.
Assistant Professor
Computer Science
Jacksonville State University
Jacksonville, AL  36265
agarrett@jsu.edu

http://mcis.jsu.edu/faculty/agarrett


On Wed, Apr 15, 2009 at 3:38 PM, Tony Teem <evilsax@gmail.com> wrote:

> Ok, here is the code I'm using to put specific labels on the ticks:
> Hashtable<Integer, JComponent> table = new Hashtable<Integer,
> JComponent>();
> String s;
>  for(int i = 0; i < tick.length; i++){
> s = "" + tick[i];
> table.put((Integer)tick[i], new JLabel(s));
>  }
> slider.setLabelTable(table);
> slider.setPaintLabels(true);
>
> what's bothering me is a) is this right?
> b) what is this?
>
> Cya on Friday,
> Tony

On Fri, Apr 17, 2009 at 12:18 AM, Tony Teem <evilsax@gmail.com> wrote:

> This question is important to the DiSH project. We have some null happy
> people in this group.
>
> What is the best way to reset a variable? i.e. you want to instatiate the
> variable over and over..
> should you do something like this?
>
> option = new Option();
> option.setTime(30);
> something.add(option);
> option = new Option();
>
> will that create a brand new option with the default "time"?
>
> or should you do it with a null like this:
>
> option = new Option();
> option.setTime(30);
> something.add(option);
> option = null;
> option = new Option();
>
> Thanks,
>
> Tony
>
From:	Tony Teem [evilsax@gmail.com]
Sent:	Friday, April 17, 2009 12:19 AM
To:	Aaron Garrett
Subject:	Quick question

This question is important to the DiSH project. We have some null happy
people in this group.

What is the best way to reset a variable? i.e. you want to instatiate the
variable over and over..
should you do something like this?

option = new Option();
option.setTime(30);
something.add(option);
option = new Option();

will that create a brand new option with the default "time"?

or should you do it with a null like this:

option = new Option();
option.setTime(30);
something.add(option);
option = null;
option = new Option();

Thanks,

Tony
From:	Tony Teem [evilsax@gmail.com]
Sent:	Thursday, April 16, 2009 11:42 PM
To:	Lori Liles; Jaleesa Elston
Subject:	Re: First problem fixed.

YAY! I made it work! Kinda... we're getting new errors, but I fixed a bunch
of the old ones. Whenever you make a new class, you have to instatiate it
like this...
Method method = new Method();

if you set it to null that makes it a nothing, no class, no anything.

Now, on to more bug squashing!

Tony

From:	Tony Teem [evilsax@gmail.com]
Sent:	Friday, April 17, 2009 9:57 AM
To:	Lori Liles; Jaleesa Elston
Subject:	Re: First problem fixed.

Ok, here is what is going on. Some things are still being set to null
because they are not being set up right.
Here is what needs to happen.

In startElement -- Every time there is a class that is started (ie Time) we
need to re-instatiate that class (ie Time time = new Time())
In characters -- We need to ensure that everything is being passed into the
proper class like it should be.
in endElement -- things need to be added properly to each thing to form the
perfect experiment.

The problem is that we are getting nulls for something things so that when
we parse the exeperiment to build the UI, it throws null pointer exceptions.
It should never do that if the schema validates the xml file.

From:	Aaron Garrett [aaron.lee.garrett@gmail.com]
Sent:	Saturday, April 18, 2009 4:17 PM
To:	Logan Moore
Cc:	Tony Teem
Subject:	Re: DISH Database Datatypes

It needs to stay as I've listed it. If you can open up the Visio document,
you should see some notes about each of those datatypes. You'll have to do a
mapping from what Tony and Lori give you to the type that you put into the
database, though. For instance, Tony and Lori may give you later_time_units
as a thing of type Time, where Time can have the values of SECONDS, MINUTES,
etc. You'll notice that the Visio document says something like SECONDS=1,
MINUTES=2, etc. So you'll add a 1 to the database as opposed to the string
"SECONDS". (There is absolutely no reason to add a string in this case. When
you're further along, you'll look back and see why.)

So look in the Visio document to find the mappings for those things. I think
that the response_delay was noted to just be stored as seconds no matter
what. So if they give it to you in minutes or hours, just do the conversion
to seconds first, and then add that to the database.

Make sense?


Aaron Garrett, Ph.D.
Assistant Professor
Computer Science
Jacksonville State University
Jacksonville, AL  36265
agarrett@jsu.edu
256-782-5364
http://mcis.jsu.edu/faculty/agarrett


On Sat, Apr 18, 2009 at 4:05 PM, Logan Moore <loganjmoore@gmail.com> wrote:

> Dr. Garrett,
> In the method table fields lori and tony are returning different data types
> than what you had specified in the schema, do I need to have them change
> these or just change it in the database.
>
> You had later_time_units specified as an integer however I had to make it a
> varchar(256) for it to work, they have it returning as "SECONDS"
> You also had type as an integer but I once again changed it to a
> varchar(256) for it to work, they have it returning as "MULTIPLE_CHOICE"
> You had response_delay as a decimal but I changed it to varchar(256), they
> have response_delay returning as "1.0 SECONDS"
>
> Please advise on how we need to fix this.
>
>
> Thanks,
> Logan

>> Tony,

>> as promised, here is version 1.3 of StudyPal.  It now fires a
>> readingResumed event when the reader begins reading again after a
>> readingPaused event.  also, StudyPal stops running once the end of the
>> document is reached (after the documentCompleted event is fired).  i
>> have tested that it stops running, but not exhaustively, so please
>> double check that.

ok, the problem is the speech program freezes the regular program until you
say somethingonce you say a word (or any noise really, even a cough), it
unfreezes the program
so you really can't even test the RealTimeUI without some sort of input
device.

>>>> Tony,

>>>> as promised, here is version 1.3 of StudyPal.  It now fires a
>>>> readingResumed event when the reader begins reading again after a
>>>> readingPaused event.  also, StudyPal stops running once the end of the
>>>> document is reached (after the documentCompleted event is fired).  i
>>>> have tested that it stops running, but not exhaustively, so please
>>>> double check that.
>>>>
>>>> as earlier stated, i have not put anything into packages, so please
>>>> run the app as shown in the SomeApp.java example (you can also refer
>>>> to the compile.bat and run.bat files).

>>>> to fool gmail.

sorry, the type casting might be in the wrong place.. you may need to use a
temp variable. like..
DoubleLimit temp = (DoubleLimit)experiment.getMethod(i);
temp.getDoubleDelay();

I had to make a request from Dr. Thornton for the Studypal to fire a
readingResumed event. He added one, but now won't jar up the files so we can
use them as a package (like we do with MigLayout). Why in the hell do people
have to be so freaking difficult?

From:	David Thornton [david.c.thornton@gmail.com]
Sent:	Saturday, April 18, 2009 10:43 AM
To:	Tony Teem
Subject:	Re: StudyPal question
Attachments:	studyPal1.3.zip_gmail

Tony,

as promised, here is version 1.3 of StudyPal.  It now fires a
readingResumed event when the reader begins reading again after a
readingPaused event.  also, StudyPal stops running once the end of the
document is reached (after the documentCompleted event is fired).  i
have tested that it stops running, but not exhaustively, so please
double check that.

as earlier stated, i have not put anything into packages, so please
run the app as shown in the SomeApp.java example (you can also refer
to the compile.bat and run.bat files).

you probably know this, but this is a .zip file.  i had to rename it
to fool gmail.

let me know how it goes.



On Sat, Apr 18, 2009 at 8:14 AM, David Thornton
<david.c.thornton@gmail.com> wrote:

> from having that error.

From:	Tony Teem [evilsax@gmail.com]
Sent:	Saturday, April 18, 2009 2:30 AM
To:	David Thornton
Subject:	Re: StudyPal question

So, i don't sleep... ever.
I think we need one more StudyPalListener event. reading resumed. Whenever
the reader pauses, the button text reads "Resume Reading", and now I need an
event to return that button (which hindsight just needs to be a field, not a
button, what's the point of pushing it when it auto pauses in just a few
short moments) back to its original form.

Or is this already built in?

On Fri, Apr 17, 2009 at 9:40 PM, David Thornton
<david.c.thornton@gmail.com>wrote:

> panel, you almost certainly have a "speech" icon.  click on it, create

> have to go through a long training bit unless you want to.  after the
> profile is created, run the program and choose that profile.

> let me know if you have other questions.

From:	Lori Liles [lileslori@gmail.com]

To:	Tony Teem
Subject:	Re: DiSH/database question

k, i will...logan is gonna need some major help!  possibly.  he is getting
errors, this is what he has....
insert("INSERT INTO method VALUES('" +
Integer.toString(getLastId("method")+1) + ",'" +
experiment.getMethod().getQuestion() + "','" +
experiment.getMethod().getRewardType() + "','" +
experiment.getMethod().getMinReward() + "','" +
experiment.getMethod().getMaxReward() + "','" +
experiment.getMethod().getLaterTimeUnits() + "','" +
experiment.getMethod().getInterTrialInterval() + "','" +
experiment.getMethod().getMethodType() + "','" +
experiment.getDoubleLimit().getDoubleDelay() + "'," +
"'',''" + ",'" +
experiment.getMethod().getResponseDelay() + "','" +
experiment.getRealTime().getPointDistType() + "','" +
experiment.getRealTime().getEscape() + "','" +
experiment.getRealTime().getRuler() + "')");

the only thing is he's getting errors for every line, b/c a) we don't have a
getRealTime() or getDoubleLimit() b) getMethod requires an int passed into
it and c) he's not pulling all of this from every method.  i've tried
explaining that to him, but i don't think he quite gets it.  i'm afraid i
might have to do it for him or something.

From:	Tony Teem [evilsax@gmail.com]
Sent:	Friday, April 17, 2009 10:27 PM
To:	Andrew Peil; Jaleesa; Logan Moore; Lori Liles; Tonya Burton
Subject:	Re: StudyPal question

Also, if you do not have a Speech Recognition tab under speech, then you do
not have speech installed.
go here and at the bottom of the page download SpeechSDK51.exe

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=5e86ec97-40a7-453f-b0ee-6583171b4530&displaylang=en#filelist

On Fri, Apr 17, 2009 at 9:46 PM, Tony Teem <evilsax@gmail.com> wrote:

> ---------- Forwarded message ----------
> From: David Thornton <david.c.thornton@gmail.com>
> Date: Fri, Apr 17, 2009 at 9:40 PM
> Subject: Re: StudyPal question
> To: Tony Teem <evilsax@gmail.com>
>
>
> yes, tony, this is easy to fix.  if you go to your windows control
> panel, you almost certainly have a "speech" icon.  click on it, create
> a new profile, name it, and go through the basic set up.  you don't
> have to go through a long training bit unless you want to.  after the
> profile is created, run the program and choose that profile.
>
> let me know if you have other questions.
>
>
> On Fri, Apr 17, 2009 at 9:25 PM, Tony Teem <evilsax@gmail.com> wrote:
> > Whenever we execute the StudyPal stuff, a window pops up named JSAPI
> Speech
> > Engines, and wants the user to select a profile. There aren't any
> profiles
> > and the option to create a new one is grayed out. Any simple solution for
> > this?
> > Thanks,
> > Tony
>

From:	Tony Teem [evilsax@gmail.com]
Sent:	Friday, April 17, 2009 10:26 PM
To:	David Thornton
Subject:	Re: StudyPal question

Just a heads up. If someone has XP and Office 2007, they do not get any
speech support and they have to download the microsoft speech SDK 5.1 from
http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=5e86ec97-40a7-453f-b0ee-6583171b4530&displaylang=en#filelist

On Fri, Apr 17, 2009 at 9:40 PM, David Thornton
<david.c.thornton@gmail.com>wrote:

> yes, tony, this is easy to fix.  if you go to your windows control
> panel, you almost certainly have a "speech" icon.  click on it, create
> a new profile, name it, and go through the basic set up.  you don't
> have to go through a long training bit unless you want to.  after the
> profile is created, run the program and choose that profile.
>
> let me know if you have other questions.

From:	Tony Teem [evilsax@gmail.com]
Sent:	Friday, April 17, 2009 9:46 PM
To:	Andrew Peil; Jaleesa; Logan Moore; Lori Liles; Tonya Burton
Subject:	Fwd: StudyPal question

---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: David Thornton <david.c.thornton@gmail.com>
Date: Fri, Apr 17, 2009 at 9:40 PM
Subject: Re: StudyPal question
To: Tony Teem <evilsax@gmail.com>


yes, tony, this is easy to fix.  if you go to your windows control
panel, you almost certainly have a "speech" icon.  click on it, create
a new profile, name it, and go through the basic set up.  you don't
have to go through a long training bit unless you want to.  after the
profile is created, run the program and choose that profile.

let me know if you have other questions.


On Fri, Apr 17, 2009 at 9:25 PM, Tony Teem <evilsax@gmail.com> wrote:
> Whenever we execute the StudyPal stuff, a window pops up named JSAPI
Speech
> Engines, and wants the user to select a profile. There aren't any profiles
> and the option to create a new one is grayed out. Any simple solution for
> this?
> Thanks,
> Tony



--
David Thornton, Ph.D.
Asst. Professor, Computer Science
Jacksonville State University
thornton@jsu.edu
256-782-5359
From:	David Thornton [david.c.thornton@gmail.com]
Sent:	Friday, April 17, 2009 9:40 PM
To:	Tony Teem
Subject:	Re: StudyPal question

yes, tony, this is easy to fix.  if you go to your windows control
panel, you almost certainly have a "speech" icon.  click on it, create
a new profile, name it, and go through the basic set up.  you don't
have to go through a long training bit unless you want to.  after the
profile is created, run the program and choose that profile.

let me know if you have other questions.


On Fri, Apr 17, 2009 at 9:25 PM, Tony Teem <evilsax@gmail.com> wrote:
> Whenever we execute the StudyPal stuff, a window pops up named JSAPI Speech
> Engines, and wants the user to select a profile. There aren't any profiles
> and the option to create a new one is grayed out. Any simple solution for
> this?
> Thanks,
> Tony



-- 
David Thornton, Ph.D.
Asst. Professor, Computer Science
Jacksonville State University
thornton@jsu.edu

absolutely every variable in each method class set to a value in the XML
file?

On Fri, Apr 17, 2009 at 4:21 PM, Jaleesa Elston <jejaggedge@gmail.com>wrote:

> upon taking an initial look at the startElement, characters, and endElement
> methods, they seem to do what they should;
> the startElement has new instantiations where ever they need to be;
>
> the characters method- everything seems to be passed properly; no strings
> are being passed to functions that only take floats UNLESS the string is
> casted as a float.
>

Ok, here's one for ya. Each scenario type takes 2 or more Options (the
class). In the case of something like DA, we should be pulling the first
scenario from the decreasingadjustment.java, then we should be creating new
scenarios until it works itself out and passing each finished scenario with
which was chosen back into the decreasingadjustment class.
Does this make sense?

From:	Tony Teem [evilsax@gmail.com]
Sent:	Saturday, April 18, 2009 6:42 PM
To:	Jaleesa Elston
Subject:	Re: method

Ok, I have a question concerning the realtime method. The person making the
test will need to be able to specify the maximum time to read for full
points right? Like, if they read for 30 minutes, they get the full amount of
points. We need to add this in to the XML and realtime.java files. the

yeah, i know...that's why it doesn't make any sense to me.  it goes to the
end experiment method from the next() and this is what it does...
     cardLayout.last(this);
Database = new database();
java.sql.Timestamp end = new java.sql.Timestamp((new
java.util.Date()).getTime());
experiment.getParticipantInformation().setStartTime(now);
experiment.getParticipantInformation().setEndTime(end);
System.out.println("---------------begin time set: " +
experiment.getParticipantInformation().getStartTime() + "-------------");
System.out.println("---------------end time set: " +
experiment.getParticipantInformation().getEndTime() + "-------------");
System.out.println("End time: " + end);
Database.insertIntoDB(experiment);


i tried adding this line ((Main)this.getParent()).validate(); after the
cardLayout.last(this); and it works, but it throws an error saying
java.lang.ClassCastException: javax.swing.JPanel cannot be cast to
edu.jsu.dish.Main  and doesn't pass the experiment to the database.

Well, inside the real time all i have it doing when either the entire
document is read, or the button is pushed is pushing data back in the
RealTime.java object. Then it executes this command:
((ExperimentUI)this.getParent()).next();

so it might be inside that method?

From:	Tony Teem [evilsax@gmail.com]
Sent:	Sunday, April 19, 2009 11:31 PM
To:	Tonya Burton
Subject:	Re: Print screen

Ok, a quick search shows that you might need to check the version of the
Java Runtime Environment. Check java.com and make sure you have the latest
version. If you do, make sure you have the latest version of the java JDK.
You can check it by going into c:\program files\java and look at the
directory that starts JDK. those numbers are the version, you should have
1.6.0_13 or something close to that.

I think I may have found something else...
As long as the mic is picking up noise the pause timer keeps resetting.

or whatever generates the line:

///////////////////// i'm in the task, and it's been 1 seconds

so just doing "lalalala" may not progress the document, but the timer keeps
resetting so there is no pause event thrown.

Tony
